dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Duminy b Phangiso 169 (137b 18x4 6x6 200m) SR: 123.35

dismissalComment.html: he;s gone for a big pull from outside off, but mishit one for once, and long on's settled under

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga b Morkel 43 (64b 7x4 0x6 86m) SR: 67.18

dismissalComment.html: Tharanga's edged one too many this time, Morkel's bowled a good length ball from round the stumps, Tharanga was looking to guide it, and has instead played on off an inside edge
Tharanga's edged one too many this time, Morkel's bowled a good length ball from round the stumps, Tharanga was looking to guide it, and has instead played on off an inside edge

short ball this time and what have you done Mahela! He plays a nothing pull shot straight into the hands of the deep midwicket fielder. There was no power in that shot, wasn't a tough delivery either. It was just below chest high..Ah well

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Morris 10 (8b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 125

dismissalComment.html: Morris has produced a wicket amid after those wides, Dilshan's got one angled in towards his pads, he's tried forcing square, but has missed it, the ball's brushed the pad and his stumps have been rattled

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga b Morkel 43 (64b 7x4 0x6 86m) SR: 67.18

dismissalComment.html: Tharanga's edged one too many this time, Morkel's bowled a good length ball from round the stumps, Tharanga was looking to guide it, and has instead played on off an inside edge

headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen c †Sangakkara b Perera 29 (31b 4x4 0x6 61m) SR: 93.54

dismissalComment.html: out of nowhere, as he so often does, Perera gets one to kick from short of a good length, it also  moves away, Petersen follows the line from the crease and edges it to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson c Tharanga b Perera 29 (37b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 78.37

dismissalComment.html: Perera has his third, digs it in short with effort, Peterson is unable to get hold of the pull, and a top edge is taken by Tharanga, a fine catch running and sliding forward from deep square leg

Herath has delivered third ball, what a delivery, flighted, AB moved a shade outside leg, ready for the inside out drive, but he ended up pushing driving the line, and Herath hit top of off with some turn

they are in a hurry, Morkel's teed off, and hit a bunker in the form of Thirimanne at long on, good effort from the fielder, he was some way in from the rope but timed his jump to take it over his head, arms outstretched

and that shall do it, Phangiso jumps out and heaves at the Colombo night air, the flighted delivery spins past, Sanga collects, waits to see if Phangiso is attempting a return, and on seeing he isn't, politely removes a bail to end the fun

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: out of nowhere, as he so often does, Perera gets one to kick from short of a good length, it also  moves away, Petersen follows the line from the crease and edges it to the keeper

no. 2 for Perera! He keeps picking up these wickets somehow. It was a fuller length delivery outside off and like he was doing in the previous over, the batsman goes forward to drive it on the up, but is not able to keep it down. Chandimal takes a good low catch at short cover

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Perera has his third, digs it in short with effort, Peterson is unable to get hold of the pull, and a top edge is taken by Tharanga, a fine catch running and sliding forward from deep square leg

dismissalText.commentary: Colin Ingram b Malinga 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: ho ho, first ball, inswinging yorker, curls in flat from that low trajectory, before Ingram can even realise what is happening, it hits the base of middle, bye bye Ingram

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c †Sangakkara b Eranga 15 (22b 3x4 0x6 24m) SR: 68.18

dismissalComment.html: has he taken that? Sangakkara can do no wrong today, clear sound as the length ball passes the outside edge, the ball is dying on Sanga, he falls forward and manages to take it in one-handed, throws it up in celebration immediately, they check whether it carried, it did, the ball moved away a bit after pitching, and that produced the edge, but what reaction from Sanga, after batting for 45 overs, he was looking good Duminy, but this was a top delivery, had to play at it

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Herath 23 (19b 5x4 0x6 27m) SR: 121.05

dismissalComment.html: Herath has delivered third ball, what a delivery, flighted, AB moved a shade outside leg, ready for the inside out drive, but he ended up pushing driving the line, and Herath hit top of off with some turn

dismissalComment.html: no. 2 for Perera! He keeps picking up these wickets somehow. It was a fuller length delivery outside off and like he was doing in the previous over, the batsman goes forward to drive it on the up, but is not able to keep it down. Chandimal takes a good low catch at short cover

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller b Dilshan 14 (22b 0x4 1x6 27m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: oh dear, what a day for South Africa, Miller's gone back to cut this length ball close to off stump, but he's played on

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel c Thirimanne b Herath 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: they are in a hurry, Morkel's teed off, and hit a bunker in the form of Thirimanne at long on, good effort from the fielder, he was some way in from the rope but timed his jump to take it over his head, arms outstretched

dismissalText.commentary: Aaron Phangiso st †Sangakkara b Herath 0 (13b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that shall do it, Phangiso jumps out and heaves at the Colombo night air, the flighted delivery spins past, Sanga collects, waits to see if Phangiso is attempting a return, and on seeing he isn't, politely removes a bail to end the fun

batsmen.shot: on side drive on front foot
off side drive on front foot

dismissalText.commentary: Aaron Phangiso st †Sangakkara b Herath 0 (13b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: and that shall do it, Phangiso jumps out and heaves at the Colombo night air, the flighted delivery spins past, Sanga collects, waits to see if Phangiso is attempting a return, and on seeing he isn't, politely removes a bail to end the fun

commentPostTextItems.html: That does it for this game. Abhishek Purohit signing off. Cheers

Chandimal starts with a huge win on captaincy debut. Chandimal: "This is my first game, good to start on winning note. Credit to the batsmen first of all. Sanga and Mahela are wily old foxes, they know how to do it. We learn lots from Sanga. I have three former captains, they give lot of advice to me on the field." When asked if he wasn't really tested as a captain in this game, he says he did demote himself down the order!

AB de Villiers: "Its not the end of the series, I know my boys will fight back. Not a lot of positives, but we can only improve. It is mentally hard to accept. But we will fight back. [Our record in SA] is something we are aware of, but we would like to win the series. We missed Hash [Amla], he is one of our class players. We were way below par but I know what the players are capable of, the second game is on the same field, we know the conditions quite well now."

Kumar Sangakkara is the Man of the Match. Sangakkara: "We had a bit of luck to start. Upul batted well. When he got out Mahela came in and raised the tempo, he had nearly caught up with me when he got out. It then became a bit easier. It was a bit two-paced, it was about facing enough deliveries and get going, I took 34 overs to get going but I stuck in there. Morkel bowled good spells, it was about absorbing that and targetting the others."

Full-blown demolition night in Colombo. Sangakkara made 169, South Africa responded with 140. The ball was coming on quite nicely, but no South Africa batsman was prepared to hang around long enough to take advantage. Ingram and Duminy got good deliveries, the others conspired in their own dismissals. No one apart from Sangakkara on either side made more than 43. What an assault that was from Sanga, was so sudden and complete it totally shocked South Africa
Sumith: "Glad that Thisara Perera gave a good reply to the Sri Lankan selectors."
jjazeel: "To all South africans, I can understand your feelings, this is exactly how we felt after the 1st ODI in south africa, where our team got all out for 43 runs"

commentTextItems.html: flatter, he is forward to block
gets forward to block a tossed up ball
defends a tossed up ball

commentPreTextItems.html: Chris: "So Sangakara has beaten South African XI. Go figure !!!"

commentTextItems.html: drives an angled full delivery to long on
plays out a short of a length ball to the off side

commentPostTextItems.html: Michael: "To me, it seems like the Proteas are like a jersey with a loose thread. Instead of taking the time to cut the loose thread off, restoring the jersey to its former glory, the selectors, CSA, whoever is just yanking at the thread, just making it worse and unraveling it further. I think it's time that SA take a little time and just rebuild."

dismissalComment.html: they are in a hurry, Morkel's teed off, and hit a bunker in the form of Thirimanne at long on, good effort from the fielder, he was some way in from the rope but timed his jump to take it over his head, arms outstretched

dismissalText.commentary: Aaron Phangiso st †Sangakkara b Herath 0 (13b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that shall do it, Phangiso jumps out and heaves at the Colombo night air, the flighted delivery spins past, Sanga collects, waits to see if Phangiso is attempting a return, and on seeing he isn't, politely removes a bail to end the fun

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: ho ho, first ball, inswinging yorker, curls in flat from that low trajectory, before Ingram can even realise what is happening, it hits the base of middle, bye bye Ingram

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: has he taken that? Sangakkara can do no wrong today, clear sound as the length ball passes the outside edge, the ball is dying on Sanga, he falls forward and manages to take it in one-handed, throws it up in celebration immediately, they check whether it carried, it did, the ball moved away a bit after pitching, and that produced the edge, but what reaction from Sanga, after batting for 45 overs, he was looking good Duminy, but this was a top delivery, had to play at it

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: out of nowhere, as he so often does, Perera gets one to kick from short of a good length, it also  moves away, Petersen follows the line from the crease and edges it to the keeper

no. 2 for Perera! He keeps picking up these wickets somehow. It was a fuller length delivery outside off and like he was doing in the previous over, the batsman goes forward to drive it on the up, but is not able to keep it down. Chandimal takes a good low catch at short cover

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Perera has his third, digs it in short with effort, Peterson is unable to get hold of the pull, and a top edge is taken by Tharanga, a fine catch running and sliding forward from deep square leg

Herath has delivered third ball, what a delivery, flighted, AB moved a shade outside leg, ready for the inside out drive, but he ended up pushing driving the line, and Herath hit top of off with some turn

they are in a hurry, Morkel's teed off, and hit a bunker in the form of Thirimanne at long on, good effort from the fielder, he was some way in from the rope but timed his jump to take it over his head, arms outstretched

and that shall do it, Phangiso jumps out and heaves at the Colombo night air, the flighted delivery spins past, Sanga collects, waits to see if Phangiso is attempting a return, and on seeing he isn't, politely removes a bail to end the fun
oh dear, what a day for South Africa, Miller's gone back to cut this length ball close to off stump, but he's played on

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan has one more, McLaren slogged this from outside off right to wide mid on, Donald has a forlorn look on his face

headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 50 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 9.5 overs (59 balls), Extras 9
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 64 balls (WU Tharanga 29, KC Sangakkara 20, Ex 3)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 81/1 in 16.0 overs (WU Tharanga 38, KC Sangakkara 22)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 22.1 overs (133 balls), Extras 12
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 47 balls (KC Sangakkara 21, DPMD Jayawardene 28, Ex 2)
KC Sangakkara: 50 off 67 balls (2 x 4, 2 x 6)
Over 28.4: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - REJ Martinesz, Batsman - DPMD Jayawardene (Struck down)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 29.2 overs (176 balls), Extras 14
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 167/2 in 33.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 57, DPMD Jayawardene 42)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 46 runs, 0 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 38.4 overs (232 balls), Extras 16
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 38 balls (KC Sangakkara 40, HDRL Thirimanne 8, Ex 2)
KC Sangakkara: 100 off 103 balls (8 x 4, 4 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 44.3 overs (267 balls), Extras 18
4th Wicket: 100 runs in 75 balls (KC Sangakkara 82, HDRL Thirimanne 16, Ex 5)
KC Sangakkara: 150 off 127 balls (17 x 4, 5 x 6)
Sri Lanka: 300 runs in 48.4 overs (293 balls), Extras 21
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 320/5 in 50.0 overs (NLTC Perera 16, LD Chandimal 1)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 63 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 50 runs in 8.5 overs (53 balls), Extras 7
Drinks: South Africa - 75/4 in 12.5 overs (F du Plessis 1)
South Africa: 100 runs in 19.6 overs (120 balls), Extras 7

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 90 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

stories.title: 'We let the heat get to us' - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: 'We let the heat get to us' - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: AB de Villiers said that the inability of South Africa's bowlers to deal with Colombo's sapping heat played a major role in the 180-run loss on Saturday, after the attack conceded 320 for 5

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara rejoices after AB de Villiers is bowled
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara rejoices after AB de Villiers is bowled, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 20, 2013

stories.title: Dominant Sangakkara gets better with age
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI: Dominant Sangakkara gets better with age
stories.summary: At 35, a lifetime of learning is propelling Kumar Sangakkara's cricket far further than his innate ability ever could. He is now churning out match-winning innings that have frustratingly eluded him
stories.byline: Andrew Fidel Fernando at the R Premadasa Stadium

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara smacks one over long-on
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara smacks one over long-on, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 20, 2013

stories.title: Sri Lanka thrash South Africa by 180 runs
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka thrash South Africa by 180 runs
stories.summary: It was not exactly 624 but Kumar Sangakkara's career-best had a similar effect as the 2006 record stand he put on with Mahela Jawaywardene against the same opposition seven years ago
